definitions.definition: Additional time played after each period of a game in order to compensate for stoppages due to player injuries; loosely extended to include time added on to compensate for all types of stoppages, i.e. synonymous with stoppage time.

definitions.definition: Regard for or consideration of oneself or one's own interests

A category (a gender), present in societies which recognize three or more genders, which is neither male nor female; in some societies, the category may contain individuals who are intersex or androgynous, while other societies may categorize transgender people into it. (Compare fourth gender.)
A descendant of white European settlers who is born in a colonized country.
Anyone with mixed ancestry born in a country colonized by white Europeans, now especially one who speaks a creole language.
Someone of black African descent who is born in the Caribbean or Americas (originally as opposed to an African immigrant).
A native-born of Francophone descent in the Louisiana territory of any race, as opposed to Anglo-American and Acadian settlers.
A lect formed from two or more languages which has developed from a pidgin to become a first language.
A woman who has a right of inheritance or who stands to inherit.
A woman who has received an inheritance.

A utensil in the shape of an inverted hollow cone terminating in a narrow pipe, for channeling liquids or granular material; typically used when transferring said substances from any container into ones with a significantly smaller opening.
A passage or avenue for a fluid or flowing substance; specifically, a smoke flue or pipe; the chimney of a steamship or the like.
To use a funnel.
To proceed through a narrow gap or passageway akin to a funnel; to condense or narrow.
definitions.example: Expect delays where the traffic funnels down to one lane.

definitions.definition: To channel, direct, or focus (emotions, money, resources, etc.).

definitions.definition: To consume (beer, etc.) rapidly through a funnel, typically as a stunt at a party.
A hinny; hybrid of male horse and female donkey.
An officer on a merchant ship next in rank to the captain and responsible to the captain for the safety and security of the ship.
An ornamental garment worn under a doublet.
A sleeveless, collarless garment worn over a shirt and under a suit jacket.
A scornful or mocking remark; a jeer or mockery
To make fun of (someone); to goad (a person) into responding, often in an aggressive manner.
Very high or tall.

definitions.definition: A window cleaner; a person who cleans windows for a living.
A large flatfish of the genus Hippoglossus, which sometimes leaves the ocean floor and swims vertically.
The entertainment industry.
Involuntary labor, especially military service, demanded by some established authority.
An enrolling or registering.
A thick white liquid produced by soaking the white inner flesh of the seed of the coconut in water and straining. It is traditionally used in Southeast Asian cuisine in curry and other gravy.
To grow or increase stature; to grow vigorously or luxuriantly, to flourish.

definitions.definition: To increase in wealth or success; to prosper, be profitable.

definitions.definition: The action of the verb to thrive.
That thrives; successful; flourishing or prospering.
To descend; to move from a higher place to a lower one.

definitions.definition: To be received or accepted.

definitions.definition: To be blamed for something; to be the scapegoat; to go to prison.

definitions.definition: To be recorded or remembered (as).

definitions.definition: To take place, happen.

definitions.definition: To stop functioning, to go offline.

To hang in equilibrium; to be balanced or suspended; hence, to be in suspense or doubt.

definitions.definition: To keep (something) in equilibrium; to hold suspended or balanced.

definitions.definition: To ascertain, as if by balancing; to weigh.
Possessing poise, having self-confidence.
Ready, prepared.
definitions.example: He stood there, poised to act, and then suddenly he drew his gun in a smooth arc.

definitions.definition: Balanced, in position, equilibrium
On board; into or within a ship or boat; hence, into or within a railway car.

definitions.definition: Alongside.

definitions.definition: On board of; onto or into a ship, boat, train, plane.

definitions.definition: Onto a horse.
Across; athwart; alongside.
An artificial intelligence researcher who believes that intelligence is too complicated (or computationally intractable) to be solved with the sorts of homogeneous system favoured by the "neats".
Untidy in appearance.

definitions.definition: Scurfy.
A game played on a rectangular court between two teams of two to six players which involves striking a ball back and forth over a net.
The inflated ball used in such a game.
(of a person) Describing one who enjoys being in crowds and socializing.
Of animals that travel in herds or packs.
Strictly thermodynamic entropy. A measure of the amount of energy in a physical system that cannot be used to do work.
A measure of the disorder present in a system.
definitions.example: Ludwig Boltzmann defined entropy as being directly proportional to the natural logarithm of the number of microstates yielding an equivalent thermodynamic macrostate (with the eponymous constant of proportionality). Assuming (by the fundamental postulate of statistical mechanics), that all microstates are equally probable, this means, on the one hand, that macrostates with higher entropy are more probable, and on the other hand, that for such macrostates, the quantity of information required to describe a particular one of its microstates will be higher. That is, the Shannon entropy of a macrostate would be directly proportional to the logarithm of the number of equivalent microstates (making it up). In other words, thermodynamic and informational entropies are rather compatible, which shouldn't be surprising since Claude Shannon derived the notation 'H' for information entropy from Boltzmann's H-theorem.

definitions.definition: The capacity factor for thermal energy that is hidden with respect to temperature http//arxiv.org/pdf/physics/0004055.

The dispersal of energy; how much energy is spread out in a process, or how widely spread out it becomes, at a specific temperature. https//web.archive.org/web/20060702234316/http://www.entropysite.com/students_approach.html
A measure of the amount of information and noise present in a signal.
The tendency of a system that is left to itself to descend into chaos.

A cocktail made from vodka, tomato juice, and usually other spices or flavorings, such as Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce, beef consommé or bouillon, horseradish, celery or celery salt, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and lemon juice.
